Title: Senior Associate, Autonomy Policy & Strategy
Location: New York, NY; San Francisco, CA; Chicago, IL; Los Angeles, CA; Seattle, WA
RoleDescription:
About the Team
DoorDashs Public Policy and Social Impact Team develops policies and advocates for legislation that supports the health of our business and empowers our community of Dashers, local business partners, and consumers. Through our advocacy on cutting-edge public policy issues and the programs that we develop, we are shaping the future of local economies. This unique team combines policy development, direct engagement with policymakers at all levels of government, advocacy campaigns, research and analysis, and programs to promote equity, safety, and sustainability. 
About the Role
DoorDash Labs is building the future of last-mile logistics through autonomous deliveryfrom ground-based delivery robots to drones. As we scale operations and engage with stakeholders at all levels, were looking for a Senior Associate, Autonomy Policy & Strategy to join our growing team. Reporting directly to our Senior Policy Advisor & Counsel, you will serve as a high-functioning program quarterback focused on keeping our work organized, strategic, and moving forward across multiple jurisdictions and workstreams.
This is a high-impact, interdisciplinary role at the intersection of public policy, city and state engagement, operations, and strategy. Youll support two growing autonomy portfoliosdelivery robots and dronesand will be critical to the success of DoorDash Labs policy, permitting, and go-to-market objectives in 2025 and beyond.
This role is ideal for someone who thrives in a fast-paced, cross-functional environment and is ready to take on increasing levels of ownership over time.This role sits within the Public Policy team and offers regular opportunities to collaborate with key verticals such as Government Relations, Public Engagement, and Public Affairs.
You're excited about this opportunity because...

Drive operational excellence across autonomy policy and deployment portfoliosensuring internal and external deadlines are met, projects stay on track, and documentation is crisp and up to date.
Support executive reporting and strategy by drafting strategic plans, tracking milestones, summarizing legislative activity, and helping prepare for high-stakes meetings (internal and external).
Own and manage logistics for government and community engagementfrom coordinating city walkthroughs and drone demos, to representing DoorDash at events and public forums.
Partner with autonomy policy and operations leads to deliver internal alignment across ops, product, legal, safety, and communications teamsensuring our messages are clear and consistent.
Translate complexity into clarity by drafting presentations, policy collateral, and talking points that break down technical concepts and highlight the impact of our technologies.
Grow into owning your own projects, including developing subject-matter expertise on public policy issues, developing and executing community and government engagement plans, , and attending events.

Were excited about you because...

Youre detail-obsessed and thrive on structure, but can also operate in ambiguity when the playbook hasnt been written yet.
You have 46 years of experience in public policy, state or local government, transportation/mobility tech, or regulatory affairsespecially in emerging tech or infrastructure sectors.
Youve worked in or closely with high-performing policy, legal, operations, or government affairs teamsand know how to track issues, influence stakeholders, and take ownership.
Youre comfortable engaging with public officials, external stakeholders, and internal executiveseither behind the scenes or as the face of a program.
Youre a strong writer and communicator who can develop crisp slides, briefings, and summaries for both technical and non-technical audiences.
You care about technology that improves how cities work and brings real benefits to communities, small businesses, and consumers.

Bonus points if you...

Have experience with urban planning, transportation policy, or land use issuesand are comfortable using GIS or other mapping tools to analyze routes, geofences, or regulatory zones.
Have experience with drones, robotics, AVs, or emerging technologies in regulated industries.
Have engaged directly with city officials, permitting agencies, or trade associations.
Have supported legislative or rulemaking campaigns at the state or local level.
Have worked in a chief-of-staff, program manager, or operations lead capacity.
Bring curiosity, hustle, and a readiness to learn fast and grow into a more senior role.

Location: Chicago, IL; Seattle, WA; Los Angeles, CA; Denver, CO; New York, NY, San Francisco, CA
RoleDescription:
About the Team
DoorDashs New Business Verticals organization focuses on accelerating one of our strategic pillars  DashMart, our grocery delivery offering. Were building and scaling new ways to delight our customers, leveraging the DoorDash platform.  DashMarts goal is to provide fresh, high quality, and local groceries to customer doorsteps, wherever that doorstep may be! The Strategic Real Estate team is responsible for identifying new locations for DashMart and optimizing our current DashMart real estate footprint. 
About the Role
We are hiring a Senior Associate across our DashMart Strategy & Operations organization. You will be responsible for assessing DashMarts real estate footprint in each market we serve, conducting related analysis (e.g. market evaluation, analyzing tradeoffs, making recommendations), and working with internal and external stakeholders. This means everything from defining high-level strategy to understanding nitty-gritty operational details. From first principles, youll help develop the optimal approach to best serve our customers in all markets across the country. In this role, you will report to the Associate Manager of the Real Estate Search & Launch team in our New Business Verticals organization. We expect this role to be remote, with an opportunity for Hybrid work.
Youre excited about this opportunity because you will...

Build. You'll have your fingerprints all over DoorDash's next big business. You'll launch, get 1% better every day, and scale something completely new. This means everything from high-level strategy to minute operational details.
Strategize. From fundamentals, you'll develop the strategy for best serving our customers.
Analyze. You'll assess the operational and financial impacts of your decisions, and iterate based on data.
Lead. You'll work with multiple teams, including engineering, product, design, operations, finance, and marketing to build this new line of business for DoorDash.

Were excited about you because...

You're excited to be creative on how you work through problems.
You don't hesitate to get in the weeds and operate at the lowest level of detail, but you're as comfortable thinking long-term.
You're unafraid of undefined processes. You are passionate about defining and carving out scope and processes. You excel at working with a diverse group of people.
You love data. You let data win arguments, and you're comfortable modeling in Excel and SQL (can perform basic functions), and have experience using data visualization tools (Tableau, PowerBI, Sigma, etc.). 
You have 1-3+ years of experience. You've succeeded at expanding businesses (whether in tech, operations, strategy, consulting, banking, supply chain, retail or a related experience).
You have completed your BS/BA Degree.

Title: DashMart Team Member - The Flats
RoleDescription:
About the Team
DashMart is a local-fulfillment center owned and operated by DoorDash, offering customers fast, reliable, and high quality delivery. Customers order their convenience, grocery, retail, and prepared foods in the DoorDash app, and our team members fulfill orders in a real, brick-and-mortar store, for our Dashers to deliver. Were open early and close late - some sites even run 24/7!
About the Role
DashMart is looking for a motivated individual that excels in fast-paced, physical environments, and is excited to roll up their sleeves and actively engage in day-to-day operations. In this role, your tasks will include:

Inventory receiving and management: Accurately receive and stock inventory, ensuring all products are accounted for and safeguarded against loss or theft. Monitor product quality and freshness and ensure proper product rotation. Follow all HACCP, food-handling and spoilage management processes.
Pick, pack and sort: Use technology similar to smartphone devices to scan packages, pick and stage orders, and conduct handoffs to Dashers.
Delight customers: Communicate clearly and pleasantly with customers through the app when substitution approvals are needed.
Warehouse organization and safety: Maintain a safe working environment by performing all duties in compliance with DashMart safety and security standards. Complete all cleaning and warehouse organization tasks as assigned by management. 
Be a team player: Contribute to a positive working environment by bringing the DoorDash one team, one fight value to life in all you do. Work with the teams goals in mind, sharing ideas, opportunities and challenges where appropriate. Engage in professional and respectful interactions with team members and customers, ensuring a positive and safe atmosphere in the warehouse.
Runner/Dasher coordination [where applicable]: Guide Runners and Dashers to pickup locations. Support parking lot management by directing traffic, collecting racks and carts, and performing other duties as assigned by management.
 Food preparation [where applicable]: Assist in light preparation of hot and/or cold foods and pre-packaging food items for staging and delivery. Willing to learn basic kitchen skills.

Youre excited about this opportunity because...

Market Competitive pay (10pm-6am will receive a $2 increase in pay)
AM/PM/Overnight shifts available
Opportunity for pay increases twice a year based upon performance
Paid time off (PTO) and sick leave
Health benefits starting Day 1 for full-time employees (Medical, Dental, & Vision)
Gym membership reimbursement (up to $75/month)
Monthly DashPass subscription (including access to HBO Max and Lyft discounts for full-time employees)
Employee Assistance Program
Career advancement opportunities

We're excited about you because...

You have great communication skills, willing to learn, and are a problem solver 
You thrive within a team environment and enjoy a variety of duties
You have experience within retail, customer service, food and beverage, administrative, healthcare or similar industries where you perform a variety of tasks
You have customer facing experience and love to delight customers
Youre able to be on your feet and handle warehouse duties including lifting up to 50 pounds (depending on site requirements) with or without accommodations. 
You have a minimum of a High school diploma or GED equivalent and are 18 years of age or older.

Title: Senior Manager, DashMart - Growth Strategy & Operations
Location: New York, NY; San Francisco, CA; Seattle, WA; Chicago, IL; Los Angeles, CA
RoleDescription:
About the Team
We're looking for someone to help scale DoorDash's next billion dollar business, DashMart. The DashMart team is focused on building a new type of convenience store, offering household essentials, groceries and local restaurant favorites to our customers' doorsteps.
About the Role
As the Sr. Manager leading our DashMart Growth Strategy & Operations team, you will be responsible for defining, executing, and optimizing growth initiatives that provide customers with a seamless in-app experience and drive sustained order volume. You will own the end-to-end Growth strategy for our Core DashMart business; including everything from weekly volume reporting and deep-diving analyses to long-range strategic planning. Your leadership will span key levers including merchandising, promotions, shopping experience (ShopEx), and go-to-market (GTM) initiatives.
As a people leader, you will directly lead the DashMart Growth team. You will be responsible for translating high-level company objectives into an actionable roadmap, driving accountability, and ensuring your team's outputs deliver measurable customer impact. This role requires deep cross-functional partnership with Product, Category Management, and Operations to bring growth strategy to life. You will report to the Director, New Business Verticals and will be the primary owner of DashMart's volume goals, forecasting, and long-range planning.This is a hybrid role, with a blend of in-office and remote work.
Youre excited about this opportunity because you will...

Build. Youll have your fingerprints all over DoorDashs New Verticals business, across grocery, convenience, retail, alcohol and more. Youll do whatever it takes to launch, get 1% better every day, and scale something completely new. This means everything from high-level strategy to nitty-gritty operational details.
Own the Core Growth Strategy: You will have end-to-end ownership of the Core DashMart growth plan, directly shaping the strategy that drives our volume goals.
Drive High-Impact Initiatives: You will spearhead critical, cross-functional growth initiatives, partnering with Product, Category Management, Local Operations, and other key teams to bring strategic projects from concept to launch.
Master the Levers of Growth: You will develop and deploy comprehensive strategies across merchandising, promotions, CRM, and shopping experience (ShopEx) to acquire, engage, and retain customers.
Translate Data into Action: You will oversee weekly volume reporting and re-forecasting, analyze customer trends, and conduct deep dives to uncover the key drivers of growth and inform future planning.
Build for the Future: You will be responsible for the long-range planning for DashMart growth, ensuring your teams roadmap is tightly aligned with ambitious, company-wide goals.

Were excited about you because...

You solve problems from first principles. Youre excited to solve problems in innovative ways, and you resist this is how its always been done thinking.

Title: DashMart Team Member
RoleDescription:
About the Team
DashMart is a local-fulfillment center owned and operated by DoorDash, offering customers fast, reliable, and high quality delivery. Customers order their convenience, grocery, retail, and prepared foods in the DoorDash app, and our team members fulfill orders in a real, brick-and-mortar store, for our Dashers to deliver. Were open early and close late - some sites even run 24/7!
About the Role
DashMart is looking for a motivated individual that excels in fast-paced, physical environments, and is excited to roll up their sleeves and actively engage in day-to-day operations. In this role, your tasks will include:

Inventory receiving and management: Accurately receive and stock inventory, ensuring all products are accounted for and safeguarded against loss or theft. Monitor product quality and freshness and ensure proper product rotation. Follow all HACCP, food-handling and spoilage management processes.
Pick, pack and sort: Use technology similar to smartphone devices to scan packages, pick and stage orders, and conduct handoffs to Dashers.
Delight customers: Communicate clearly and pleasantly with customers through the app when substitution approvals are needed.
Warehouse organization and safety: Maintain a safe working environment by performing all duties in compliance with DashMart safety and security standards. Complete all cleaning and warehouse organization tasks as assigned by management. 
Be a team player: Contribute to a positive working environment by bringing the DoorDash one team, one fight value to life in all you do. Work with the teams goals in mind, sharing ideas, opportunities and challenges where appropriate. Engage in professional and respectful interactions with team members and customers, ensuring a positive and safe atmosphere in the warehouse.
Runner/Dasher coordination [where applicable]: Guide Runners and Dashers to pickup locations. Support parking lot management by directing traffic, collecting racks and carts, and performing other duties as assigned by management.
 Food preparation [where applicable]: Assist in light preparation of hot and/or cold foods and pre-packaging food items for staging and delivery. Willing to learn basic kitchen skills.

Youre excited about this opportunity because...

Market Competitive pay (10pm-6am will receive a $2 increase in pay)
AM/PM/Overnight shifts available
Opportunity for pay increases twice a year based upon performance
Paid time off (PTO) and sick leave
Health benefits starting Day 1 for full-time employees (Medical, Dental, & Vision)
Gym membership reimbursement (up to $75/month)
Monthly DashPass subscription (including access to HBO Max and Lyft discounts for full-time employees)
Employee Assistance Program
Career advancement opportunities

Were excited about you because...

You have great communication skills, willing to learn, and are a problem solver 
You thrive within a team environment and enjoy a variety of duties
You have experience within retail, customer service, food and beverage, administrative, healthcare or similar industries where you perform a variety of tasks
You have customer facing experience and love to delight customers
Youre able to be on your feet and handle warehouse duties, including lifting up to 50 pounds (depending on site requirements) with or without accommodations. 
You have a minimum of a High school diploma or GED equivalent and are 18 years of age or older.

Design network expansion  Build and execute coverage strategies to support DoorDashs nationwide growth. Develop market entry plans, prioritize regions, and inform site selection with external partners.

Lead execution at scale  Translate strategy into clear roadmaps, manage timelines for market launches, and deliver against milestones.

Were excited about you because...

Title: Engineering Manager, Financial Data Platform
RoleDescription:
About the Team
DoorDash is looking for an Engineering Manager with a strong platform mindset to lead the Financial Data Platform team. The teams mission is to build foundational systems that collect raw financial data from all DoorDash companies, and process it into a unified, integrated single source of truth data model. These systems sit at the intersection of all teams that are serving our three-sided marketplace (Consumers, Merchants, Dashers). 
Key functions of this team include: 
Data ingestion & integration: Build SDKs and services that make it extremely easy to ingest and integrate data from all DoorDash products and services. 
Data quality & governance: Ensure that the data is complete, timely, and accurate. Build intelligent tools that automatically help validate, standardize, and regulate the data, and remediate errors while maintaining strict immutability guarantees. 
Data storage: Provide a reliable and structured way to store the data, and make it easily accessible with appropriate data controls. 
About the Role
As the Engineering Manager for the Financial Data Platform team, you will lead a talented and passionate team of software engineers focused on building and scaling big data systems and platform services that intelligently process billions of events per month. Your leadership will ensure the delivery of exceptional systems that are scalable, reliable, and unlock the best-in-class product and tech innovations. Youll partner with PMs, data engineers, and senior leadership to define and execute a strategic roadmap that balances scalable platform development with cutting-edge tools.
You're excited about this opportunity because you will...

Lead and grow a team of exceptional backend and full stack engineers delivering end-to-end engineering solutions
Be the technologist and system thinker who connects the dots between technology and the business and unlocks business opportunities through tech innovation
Collaborate with product managers, business leaders, and key stakeholders to determine the team's roadmap and vision, and manage execution against that roadmap
Provide architectural guidance and professional development for a team of 8+ 
Encourage innovation, teamwork, implementation of cutting-edge technologies, and outside-of-the-box thinking 
Oversee the hiring process for your team, in partnership with recruiting, to grow a diverse and inclusive team
Drive key business metrics

We're excited about you because you have... 

BS, MS, or PhD. in Computer Science or related field
3+ years of experience in people management leading full-stack teams (backend & web) of 8+ engineers
8+ years of industry experience
A customer-centric mindset and will apply that to building out platform services
Strong product sense and thought partnership with cross-functional peers
Experience with distributed system design, system scaling, and performance optimization
AI fluency and proven ability to find innovative applications of AI for financial data platform
Humility - willing to get into the details and open to feedback
Growth mindset  you're eager to expand your skill set and excited to carve out your career path in a hyper-growth setting
Adaptability, resiliency, and the ability to thrive in ambiguity  things can change quickly, and you'll need to help the team evolve

Runner/Dasher coordination [where applicable]: Guide Runners and Dashers to pickup locations. Support parking lot management by directing traffic, collecting racks and carts, and performing other duties as assigned by management.
 Food preparation [where applicable]: Assist in light preparation of hot and/or cold foods and pre-packaging food items for staging and delivery. Willing to learn basic kitchen skills.

Career advancement opportunities

Title: Senior Manager, People Process Transformation and Continuous Improvement
RoleDescription:
About the Role
We are building a radically more efficient, intelligent, and AI-powered People Operating System. As the Senior Manager, People Process Transformation and Continuous Improvement, you will lead a global team of process strategists dedicated to reimagining the end-to-end people experience at DoorDash and Wolt.
In this role, youll lead bold, hands-on transformation that connects people, process, and technology in ways that save thousands of hours, improve employee experiences, and deliver measurable business impact. You will guide your team to compress cycle times, remove friction, and embed automation into our highest-impact People processes, while balancing scalability with the nuance of global and local requirements.
You will report directly to the VP, People Platforms and partner closely with COEs, business unit People leaders, engineers, product managers, and operations leaders worldwide. Your success will be measured by accelerated process velocity, measurable ROI, experience improvement, and lasting adoption.
You are excited about this opportunity because you will

Lead and develop a high-performing team of Senior People Process Strategists, coaching them to deliver transformation outcomes across multiple workstreams and geographies
Set a vision and roadmap for continuous improvement across global People processes, aligned to enterprise automation and transformation goals
Apply Lean Six Sigma and systems thinking principles to diagnose root causes, redesign processes, and embed automation and self-service at scale
Partner with tech and product leaders to deliver solutions that balance process simplification, policy alignment, and end-user experience
Oversee the creation of future-state process architectures that integrate seamlessly with AI-powered tools and platforms
Ensure all process changes are backed by quantifiable success metrics such as time savings, SLA compression, ROI, and adoption rates

Champion end-user empathy, ensuring solutions are intuitive, accessible, and elevate the employee experience
Institutionalize a culture of continuous improvement, empowering teams to challenge legacy processes and adopt a data-driven approach to change

You bring 10+ years of hands-on Continuous Improvement leadership, ideally in HR, Talent Acquisition, or other large-scale operational functions
You are an expert in Lean Six Sigma methodologies (Black Belt or equivalent experience) and adept at tools like Value Stream Mapping, 5 Whys, and root cause analysis
You have led large-scale, multi-system process transformations across global organizations
You are a systems thinker who can see the full architecture of how people, process, and technology interconnect and then act decisively on the right levers
You have a proven record of measurable impact such as compressing cycle times, reducing costs, increasing quality, and boosting adoption
You are fluent in process mapping, service blueprinting, and org/process/tech decomposition
You lead with end-user empathy, building processes that work for the people who actually use them
You thrive in high-change, high-ambiguity environments, using data and structured thinking to cut through complexity

You will lead the team shaping the future of how work gets done, not just implementing tools but rebuilding the operating system that powers our global workforce
You will operate at the intersection of technology, people, and process, making bold changes that scale across geographies and business units
You will be surrounded by smart, mission-driven teammates who move fast, value outcomes over optics, and challenge each other to deliver the best work of their careers
You will leave a lasting impact by building a future-ready, AI-powered People Operating System that becomes the industry benchmark

About the Team
The New Verticals team is all about expanding DoorDash beyond Restaurants, and helping deliver anything our Customers want. Our Catalog, Fulfillment and Logistics team has three major mandates to effectively onboard merchants, fulfill every order with speed & accuracy and improve our logistics network. We are able to do this by identifying efficiencies, building product toolings and launching operational processes at scale. You will own metrics, pull operational & product levers and drive impactful results across our Grocery, Convenience, Alcohol and Retail businesses.
About the Role
The Catalog pod is focused on improving how we onboard merchants with speed, quality and accuracy through tools, technologies and operational process. The projects we work on are diverse and impact all sides of our marketplace -  Dashers, Consumers, and Merchants. We are hiring two Senior Associates so throughout the interview process, you will be considered for both positions and we will align based on role fit which role is best suited for your strengths. Depending on the role, you might focus on identifying ways to implement new technologies into how we automate onboarding processes for Merchants and CPG partners alike.
We operate in a hybrid model; we do try to get the entire team together once a quarter in person and all of our offices are open should you choose to go in. In our major hubs, we do weekly office days with those local as a team as well! 
Youre excited about this opportunity because you will...

Analyze. You are familiar with SQL and love working with data to drive business decision-making. 
Build. You will help build strategic initiatives that impact all three sides of our marketplace; this can vary from our shopper rewards programs to dasher efficiency to merchant onboarding. This means everything from high-level strategy to operational details.
Collaborate. You will advocate internally for solutions to enhance the user experience. Where a product or operations solution is needed to unlock growth and reduce cost, you will advocate for those resources with your central partners.
Lead. You will help lead cross-functional work streams to develop an operating playbook to establish processes and guidelines to enhance how we operate New Verticals wide initiatives like our Dasher Shop & Deliver platform, Shopper program, Logistics network and so much more! 
Strategize. You will help develop the strategy for how we bring the local community directly to our consumers, achieving perfect quality, speed and accuracy every time. You will help create quarterly and annual plans that push our business forward and are aligned with our product capabilities. You will help these teams identify opportunities for enhancing our existing product offering and methods to improve delivery quality.

Were excited about you because...

You solve problems from first principles. Youre excited to think innovatively, and you resist this is how its always been done thinking.

You have a completed Bachelors Degree.

We're looking for a Learning Experience Designer to create new and continuing learning materials for employees and our customer support operations throughout the world.

DashMart is a local-fulfillment center owned and operated by DoorDash, offering customers fast, reliable, and high quality delivery. Were open early and close late - some sites even run 24/7!
About the Role
DashMart is looking for a motivated individual that excels in fast-paced, physical environments, and is excited to roll up their sleeves and actively engage in day-to-day operations. In this role, your tasks will include:

Inventory receiving and management: Accurately receive and stock inventory, ensuring all products are accounted for and safeguarded against loss or theft. Monitor product quality and freshness and ensure proper product rotation. Follow all HACCP, food-handling and spoilage management processes.
Pick, pack and sort: Use technology similar to smartphone devices to scan packages, pick and stage orders, and conduct handoffs to Dashers.
Delight customers: Communicate clearly and pleasantly with customers through the app when substitution approvals are needed.
Warehouse organization and safety: Maintain a safe working environment by performing all duties in compliance with DashMart safety and security standards. Complete all cleaning and warehouse organization tasks as assigned by management. 
Be a team player: Contribute to a positive working environment by bringing the DoorDash one team, one fight value to life in all you do. Work with the teams goals in mind, sharing ideas, opportunities and challenges where appropriate. Engage in professional and respectful interactions with team members and customers, ensuring a positive and safe atmosphere in the warehouse.
Runner/Dasher coordination [where applicable]: Guide Runners and Dashers to pickup locations. Support parking lot management by directing traffic, collecting racks and carts, and performing other duties as assigned by management.
 Food preparation [where applicable]: Assist in light preparation of hot and/or cold foods and pre-packaging food items for staging and delivery. Willing to learn basic kitchen skills.

You have great communication skills, willing to learn, and are a problem solver

Title: Senior Associate, Strategy & Operations - Drive Strategic Initiatives
RoleDescription:
About the Team
DoorDash Drive is our companys hypergrowth fulfillment platform serving restaurants, grocers, and retailers across the United States and abroad. DoorDash Drive allows restaurants, grocers, and retailers to enable ecommerce fulfillment for their first-party experiences. 
As part of the Drive team, the Senior Associate will have the opportunity to help define, test and scale Drives next biggest bets.
About the Role
As a senior associate on our Strategic Initiatives team, youll be responsible for designing and executing our go-to-market strategy for our next billion dollar venture.
You will be responsible for finding product market fit, building strategic go to market strategy, setting pricing, exploring the competitive landscape and running tests to prove hypotheses for new merchant facing customer centric products within the restaurant space. 
You will set & own core goals for your business and will need to be highly cross-functional (product, eng, marketing, finance, etc) to achieve volume and profitability goals. The ideal candidate for this role should be a self-starter with an entrepreneurial mindset, able to take ownership and create plans from scratch, and drive execution while obtaining cross-functional buy-in to achieve Drives strategic goals.
Youre Excited About This Opportunity Because You Will ...

Build and own the business  Drive growth and adoption of some of our top priority projects
Business development  Develop and foster deep relationships with top priority merchant partners to iterate and grow the business.  Key Merchant point of contact within the Strategic Initiatives Strategy & Ops team
Go-to-market strategy  Build a strong understanding of product market fit, value proposition, pricing, and the competitive landscape, and help the team develop a go-to-market strategy based on these inputs. Grow a high-potential offering within a high-growth business.
Improve the product  Guide operational improvements for our merchant partners by understanding their needs and working with internal partners to design solutions throughout the product experience. Steer the Drive product roadmap informed by quantitative analysis and qualitative merchant feedback
Influence  Work cross-functionally with our Product, Engineering, Finance, Analytics, Support, Sales and Account Management teams to drive growth and scale.
Experiment  Evaluate and test various revenue, cost and quality drivers.

Were Excited About You Because...

You have a Bachelors degree or higher
You have 3+ years of experience in consulting, strategy, or operations; high-growth/early-stage startup or entrepreneurial experience is a big plus
Your expert communication and interpersonal skills set you apart
You are a strong analytical thinker who can provide applicable recommendations out of a complex, sometimes murky, dataset
You have a bias towards action and are able to thrive in a fast-paced, constantly changing work environment
Your charisma allows you to excel at connecting with Merchants and internal teams to promote products and drive adoption
You crave responsibility and want to shape the vision and direction of the company 
Youre willing to get your hands dirty and youre open to feedback.
Youre excellent at motivating potential partners to see the benefits DoorDash Drive will bring to their business
(Nice to Have) You have experience in Customer Retention, Growth Marketing/CRM and SEO/GEO

The New Verticals team is building the future of local commerce through expanding our product offerings on our marketplace platform. We launched in 2020 and have since then built world-class operations to delight our customers with access to Grocery, Convenience, Alcohol, and Retail delivery through our marketplace. This team shapes the future of DoorDash Grocery. Join us in our global mission to empower and grow local economies!
About the Role
As we continue to scale our Grocery business, were looking to hire multiple Senior Associates on our Grocery Strategy & Operations team.! As a member of the team, youll define key go-to-market strategies, launch growth initiatives, and dive into data to identify trends that will inform operational + product strategies, all while working with a wide array of cross-functional teams. This role is based in New York or San Francisco. We operate in a hybrid model of in-office & remote work, as well as travel to collaborate with colleagues across different offices in person! 
Youre excited about this opportunity because you will...

Strategize. From first principles, youll develop the optimal strategy for best serving our customers.
Operate. Own tracking dashboards and manage week over week metrics to drive high quality operations.
Analyze. Build models using Excel and SQL to evaluate the economic, operational and strategic costs and benefits of various programs and experiments
Experiment. Youll transform strategies into operational experiments that create measurable and actionable outcomes
Build. Youll have your fingerprints all over DoorDashs next big business. Youll launch new products, get 1% better every day, and scale something completely new. This means everything from high-level strategy to operational details.
Lead, collaborate and Influence. Youll partner with and influence cross-functional teams including growth, quality, design, marketing, partnerships and product team to build and scale the Grocery business.

Title: Manager, Technology Sourcing  Software (AI Sourcing)
RoleDescription:
About the Team
The Global Strategic Sourcing team at DoorDash is at the forefront of aligning supplier strategy with long-term business goals. We deliver a strategic advantage by streamlining external spend, managing supplier risk, and optimizing value across critical categories. With a focus on transparency, scalability, and stakeholder partnership, we drive innovation and operational efficiency across the organization.As AI rapidly reshapes the technology landscape, our team plays a critical role in enabling responsible adoption and maximizing value from AI investments while ensuring careful risk management.
About the Role
We are seeking a results-driven Manager of Global Strategic Sourcing & Category Management  Software (AI Focus) to lead sourcing activities across all company wide AI initiatives. In this individual contributor role, you will serve as the primary sourcing expert and single point of contact for all AI supplier engagementsfrom proof-of-concept (POC) through enterprise adoption. You will partner closely with Engineering, Product, Security, Legal, Finance, and business stakeholders to shape AI strategy, manage supplier relationships, and ensure responsible deployment of AI technologies.You will own the end-to-end sourcing lifecycle for AI suppliers, balancing innovation with mindful risk assessment, and act as the PMO for all AI POCs by tracking progress, coordinating cross-functional (XFN) efforts, and ensuring stakeholder alignment. This role requires a deep enthusiasm for technology, fluency in AI supplier landscapes, and an ability to evaluate both risks and rewards of emerging solutions.You will report to the Senior Manager, Global Strategic Sourcing within the Finance org. This is a U.S.-based remote role, with 2030% travel for team events, offsites, and supplier engagements.
You're excited about this opportunity because...

Lead end-to-end sourcing and category strategy for AI and software solutions, including evaluation, selection, contracting, and lifecycle management.
Serve as the single point of contact for AI suppliers, coordinating proof-of-concepts, tracking outcomes, and managing full-cycle adoption decisions.
Act as the Program Management Office (PMO) for all AI POCs, ensuring structured tracking, reporting, and cross-functional alignment with stakeholders.
Partner with Engineering, Security, Legal, Product, and Finance to establish supplier strategy, risk frameworks, and responsible AI practices.
Execute RFx (RFI/RFP/RFQ) processes to evaluate innovative AI solutions, balancing performance, cost, risk, and long-term business value.
Negotiate complex SaaS and AI supplier contracts (MSAs, SOWs, licensing, and service agreements) to protect DoorDashs commercial, technical, and legal interests.
Establish sourcing frameworks to enable stakeholder self-service, while guiding on high-complexity or strategic engagements.
Track supplier performance, market trends, and emerging AI capabilities to inform sourcing strategy and risk mitigation.
Deliver measurable business impact through supplier consolidation, cost optimization, and value-added partnerships.
Champion a stakeholder-obsessed mindset, ensuring strong alignment, clear communication, and trusted advisory support to business partners.

We're excited about you because...

7+ years of sourcing and procurement experience, with demonstrated success in software and SaaS category management.
Expertise in AI product sourcing, including evaluation of generative AI, ML/analytics platforms, automation tools, and specialized AI vendors.
Strong knowledge of supplier landscapes across AI-first companies (e.g., OpenAI, Anthropic, Observe.AI, Cursor) and SaaS providers with embedded AI.
Proven track record as program manager/POC coordinator, driving structured execution of supplier pilots and adoption programs.
Strong commercial acumen and risk-balanced negotiation skills with experience structuring complex software and AI supplier contracts.
Demonstrated ability to collaborate cross-functionally with Engineering, Security, Legal, Finance, and Product teams.
Enthusiasm for emerging technologies and mindfulness of AI risks, ethics, and compliance considerations.
Exceptional communication and stakeholder engagement skills, with a stakeholder-obsessed mindset.
Comfortable operating in a fast-paced, dynamic environment, balancing multiple priorities with precision.
Bachelors degree in Business, Finance, Supply Chain, or a related field (MBA or advanced degree a plus).

Title: Group Product Manager, Ads Marketplace
Location: San Francisco, CA; New York, NY; Seattle, WA
RoleDescription:
About the Team
The Ads Marketplace team is responsible for optimizing the delivery and performance of ads across the DoorDash platform. Our mission is to balance advertiser outcomes and consumer experience, driving efficient, scalable, and high-performing ad placements. This team operates across four core areas: Inventory, which determines where ads appear throughout the consumer journey; Economics, which drives pricing and auction mechanics for maximum efficiency; Quality, which ensures the right ad is shown at the right moment; and Formats, which focuses on innovating ad formats and merchandising to maximize impact. As the worlds fastest growing retail media network, DoorDash Ads has surpassed a $1B run rate, and the Ads Marketplace team is leading the charge.
About the Role
As the Ads Marketplace GPM, you will manage a team of Product Managers to scale the Ads business rapidly and responsibly. Youll define and execute the strategy for sustainable growth, with a focus on improving iROAS (incremental Return on Ad Spend) and delivering long-term value to advertisers. Your work will unlock new growth levers through pricing innovation, ad quality improvements, and personalized delivery systems. Youll also establish and monitor the core marketplace metrics and principles that balance advertiser performance with a high-quality user experience. This is a highly cross-functional role that operates at the intersection of product, engineering, data science, sales, and marketing, requiring a strong blend of strategic thinking, technical depth, and execution excellence.
Youll report directly to Mayur Chaudhari, Director of Merchant Ads, and work in a hybrid model that blends remote flexibility with in-person collaboration.
Youre excited about this opportunity because you will...

Lead the core product and economics strategy of DoorDashs ads business
Scale the platform by improving auction dynamics and launching new ad formats
Own ad relevance and quality, making sure users see the right ad at the right time
Build personalization systems that dynamically determine ad load and placement across surfaces
Partner with teams across the company to define how ads and promotions coexist, delivering maximum value for merchants
Work on high-impact products that directly influence ads revenue, merchant ROI, and user engagement

Were excited about you because...

You have 8+ years of Product Management experience, with at least 2 years leading PM teams.
You have experience with Ads, Promotions, or Merchandising on consumer platforms and/or in high-scale marketplaces.
You combine strong, strategic thinking and operational execution, with a track record of shipping high-impact features.
You excel at cross-functional collaboration, and can influence and align stakeholders across a complex organization.
You are a clear communicator with strong analytical skills and experience leading executive-level reviews.
You have deep empathy for users and a passion for solving complex, real-world problems.
You are energized by DoorDashs mission and the opportunity to help local economies thrive.

Title: DashMart Team Member - Morrow
RoleDescription:
About the Team
DashMart is a local-fulfillment center owned and operated by DoorDash, offering customers fast, reliable, and high quality delivery. Customers order their convenience, grocery, retail, and prepared foods in the DoorDash app, and our team members fulfill orders in a real, brick-and-mortar store, for our Dashers to deliver. Were open early and close late - some sites even run 24/7!
About the Role
DashMart is looking for a motivated individual that excels in fast-paced, physical environments, and is excited to roll up their sleeves and actively engage in day-to-day operations. In this role, your tasks will include:

Inventory receiving and management: Accurately receive and stock inventory, ensuring all products are accounted for and safeguarded against loss or theft. Monitor product quality and freshness and ensure proper product rotation. Follow all HACCP, food-handling and spoilage management processes.
Pick, pack and sort: Use technology similar to smartphone devices to scan packages, pick and stage orders, and conduct handoffs to Dashers.
Delight customers: Communicate clearly and pleasantly with customers through the app when substitution approvals are needed.
Warehouse organization and safety: Maintain a safe working environment by performing all duties in compliance with DashMart safety and security standards. Complete all cleaning and warehouse organization tasks as assigned by management. 
Be a team player: Contribute to a positive working environment by bringing the DoorDash one team, one fight value to life in all you do. Work with the teams goals in mind, sharing ideas, opportunities and challenges where appropriate. Engage in professional and respectful interactions with team members and customers, ensuring a positive and safe atmosphere in the warehouse.
Runner/Dasher coordination [where applicable]: Guide Runners and Dashers to pickup locations. Support parking lot management by directing traffic, collecting racks and carts, and performing other duties as assigned by management.
 Food preparation [where applicable]: Assist in light preparation of hot and/or cold foods and pre-packaging food items for staging and delivery. Willing to learn basic kitchen skills.

Youre excited about this opportunity because...

Market Competitive pay (10pm-6am will receive a $2 increase in pay)
AM/PM/Overnight shifts available
Opportunity for pay increases twice a year based upon performance

Gym membership reimbursement (up to $75/month)
Monthly DashPass subscription (including access to HBO Max and Lyft discounts for full-time employees)
Employee Assistance Program
Career advancement opportunities

We're excited about you because...

You have great communication skills, willing to learn, and are a problem solver 
You thrive within a team environment and enjoy a variety of duties

You have customer facing experience and love to delight customers
Youre able to be on your feet and handle warehouse duties including lifting up to 50 pounds (depending on site requirements) with or without accommodations.

RoleDescription:
About the Team
New Verticals is an exciting team at DoorDash that is building and scaling new ways to delight our customers beyond restaurant deliveries (e.g., Grocery, Convenience, Alcohol, Retail).
Our Catalog, Fulfillment and Logistics team has three major mandates to effectively onboard merchants, fulfill every order with speed & accuracy and improve our logistics network. We are able to do this by identifying efficiencies, building product toolings and launching operational processes at scale. You will own metrics, pull operational & product levers and drive impactful results across our Grocery, Convenience, Alcohol and Retail businesses.
About the Role
We are expanding our Fulfillment team by hiring an Associate. In this role, you will lead the scoping, go-to-market, and iteration of cutting-edge product features to help DoorDash improve order quality across our Convenience, Grocery, Alcohol, and Retail businesses. You will also work on improving Dasher tooling & technology to make them more efficient in store. Your work will be highly visible and impactful, and involve partnering with the Machine Learning, Engineering, Product, and Data Science teams. You will sit in the Fulfillment, Logistics & Catalog group within our New Verticals Strategy & Operations organization. This is an individual contributor position.  
Youre excited about this opportunity because you will...

Analyze: You love working with data and using data to drive business decision-making. You love talking to customers, unpacking their feedback, and coming up with improvement opportunities.
Strategize: You will own and deliver on improving key metrics. You will create quarterly and annual plans that push our business forward and are aligned with our product capabilities. You will help these teams identify opportunities for enhancing our existing product offering and methods to improve delivery quality.
Lead: You will help lead cross-functional work streams of Engineers, Data Scientists and Designers to develop best in class product features that will enhance the quality of New Vertical deliveries
Own: You love owning problems end-to-end. You display ownership for the products and business lines that you are responsible for. You never shy away from raising your hand to solve ambiguous problems and are able to motivate and empower your teammates to go above and beyond.

Were excited about you because...

Youre analytical. You have a data-driven mindset, live and breathe numbers, and use them to understand problems and tell stories. Youre very comfortable using Excel and visualizing data; you ideally have SQL experience!
You have 1-3+ years of experience. Ideally in consulting, strategy, operations, technology, banking, food & beverage, high-growth startups, etc.
You solve problems from first principles. Youre excited to think innovatively, and you resist this is how its always been done thinking.
Youre equally comfortable operating at 10,000 feet and 1 foot. You dont hesitate to get in the weeds and operate at the lowest level of detail, but youre just as comfortable thinking long-term and inspiring a team.
You have a completed Bachelors Degree.

We are revolutionizing the delivery experience for merchants and customers by offering the next generation of fulfillment services. Were looking for someone to join the Drive team to rapidly scale our next big bet and disrupt the delivery industry.

In this highly collaborative role, youll serve as the connective tissue between product, ops, business development, and external partnersdriving end-to-end execution, ensuring alignment on goals, and delivering results.
Success depends on your ability to understand our partners goals and business models inside and outtranslating that insight into clear priorities and actionable roadmaps. Youll drive initiatives from concept to launch, working closely with product, ops, and business teams to ensure alignment and impact.  Were looking for a first-principles thinker with a strong sense of ownershipsomeone who can dive deep into the details while also shaping the bigger picture.
Reporting to the Manager of Drive Strategy and Operations, you will work closely with product, engineering, operations, integrations, business development teams to make your vision a reality. 
Youre excited about this opportunity because you will...

Strategize  Understand the needs of our partners, prioritize those needs by impact, and create solutions with cross-functional partners

Collaborate  Value partnerships, and excel at working across Operations, Product, Sales, Engineering, and more to bring new products and services to merchants.

You have an extreme sense of ownership. You display extreme ownership for the products and business lines that you are responsible for. You never shy away from raising your hand to solve ambiguous problems and are able to motivate and empower your teammates to go above and beyond.

You thrive with a diverse set of responsibilities.  You love working across a breadth of disciplines and teams.  
Youre an analytical powerhouse.  You let data win arguments, and youre comfortable pulling your own data in SQL and modeling in Excel.
Youre even-keeled. You thrive under pressure and maintain a sense of calm when faced with challenging and time-sensitive obstacles.
Youre persuasive. You are an effective communicator, speaking as if youre right and listening as if youre wrong. You meet people on their level.  
You act with urgency.  Speed excites you. You prefer an accomplishment today to an accomplishment tomorrow. 
Youre a builder. You enjoy building from the ground up and excel in creating structure and process.
You dont need a guide. You dive into difficult problems and come up with a plan.
You have 3+ years of experience.  Youve succeeded in competitive, challenging environments where youve driven both strategy and execution. 
You have a Bachelors Degree; Masters Degree preferred but not required.

Bonus Points

You are fluent in SQL and Excel 
You have experience in managing or supporting a complex P&L 
You have experience in the tech industry, launching and growing new partners and products

Title: Fraud Insights Operations Analyst - Decision Integrity
RoleDescription:
About the Team
The Decision Integrity Team within the DoorDash Fraud Insights department stands at the forefront of ensuring the security and integrity of our platform. As a member of this team, you'll play a pivotal role in proactively identifying and thwarting potential instances of fraud through case decision accuracy analysis. Central to our fraud prevention strategy is the belief that proactive measures are key to shaping the future, rather than merely anticipating it. With each project we undertake, we strive to develop solutions that safeguard our company. Approaching every investigation with unwavering determination, we fearlessly unearth truths, even when they may be uncomfortable or inconvenient. Our culture is rooted in continuous learning, fostering an environment where every team member is encouraged to grow and adapt.
About the Role
As a top-tier operator, the Fraud Insights Analyst serves as the primary investigator within the team. They possess proficiency in various processes and extensive knowledge of fraud behaviors. Responsibilities entail conducting in-depth investigations into fraud cases and providing detailed findings to facilitate long-term fraud reduction efforts. Moreover, the role is instrumental in maintaining a delicate balance between optimizing the experience for our Consumers, Dashers, and Merchants, and combating fraudulent activities effectively. Reporting directly to the Fraud Operations Associate Manager, the Analyst works closely with our S&O partners to fulfill project and analytic needs.At DoorDash, we believe in fostering a culture of meaningful connection, collaboration, and professional growth through in-office interactions. This position requires an in-office presence at the DoorDash corporate office in Tempe and the employee must live within a commutable 50 miles from the office. In-office days are determined by the business and can change based on business needs. Connect with the recruiter to determine what the in-office requirement for this role is. This role will be assigned a schedule that may include evenings, weekends, and holidays. These schedules will be adjusted periodically to meet the needs of our business.
Youre excited about this opportunity because you will...

Investigation: Conduct detailed investigations on flagged transactions or accounts to determine if fraud has occurred. This may involve reviewing account histories, transaction logs, and communication records.
Fraud Prevention: Develop and implement fraud prevention strategies, policies, and procedures to minimize the occurrence of fraudulent activities.
Data Analysis: Analyze data and perform statistical analysis to identify patterns, trends, and anomalies that may indicate fraudulent behavior.
Reporting: Prepare comprehensive reports on fraud trends, incidents, and mitigation strategies to be presented to management and stakeholders.
Training and Awareness: Conduct training sessions and awareness programs to educate employees about fraud risks, prevention techniques, and reporting procedures.

What you bring to the table...

You have 2+ years of experience in fraud, finance, or other professional operational roles.
You have strong analytical and problem-solving skills with the ability to identify patterns and anomalies.
You have advanced Google sheet/ Excel skills, and familiarity with data analysis and statistical techniques.
You have knowledge of fraud prevention strategies, techniques, and tools.
You have proficiency in using fraud detection software and systems.
You have the ability to collaborate effectively with cross-functional teams.
You have knowledge of relevant laws, regulations, and industry standards related to fraud prevention.

Why Youll Love Working at DoorDash

We are leaders - Leadership is not limited to our management team. Its something everyone at DoorDash embraces and embodies.
We are doers - We believe the only way to predict the future is to build it. Creating solutions that will lead our company and our industry is what we do -- on every project, every day. 
We are learners - Everyone here is continually learning on the job, no matter if weve been in a role for one year or one minute.
We are customer-obsessed - Our mission is to grow and empower local economies. We are committed to our customers, merchants, and dashers and believe in connecting people with possibility.
We are all DoorDash - The magic of DoorDash is our people, together making our inspiring goals attainable and driving us to greater heights.

Title: S&O Associate, Environmental Sustainability
RoleDescription:
About the team
The Public Policy and Social Impact Team is a dynamic group working to help Dashers, local businesses, and cities thrive. From advancing our vision for the future of work, to supporting small businesses through innovative partnerships and programs, to combating food insecurity and promoting environmental sustainability through the power of the DoorDash platform, we are at the cutting edge of public policy and community issues. 
About the Role
You will play an integral role in building our environmental sustainability strategy in different areas including transportation and logistics, take-out packaging, clean energy, and carbon emissions measurement and reductions. You will work on projects that focus on opportunities to test, measure, and address DoorDashs climate impact. Across the board, we aim to do this in a way that improves outcomes for merchants, Dashers, customers, and our business.  
Youll develop and test hypotheses, and operate pilots and processes. Additionally, a significant part of this role is serving as our teams point person for data and analytics across sustainability projects. 
You will report into our Social Impact and Sustainability team within the Public Policy organization. 
Youre excited about this opportunity because you will...

Operate at the lowest level of detail to become an expert of this problem space
Learn how to develop strategies and act on them
Build analysis to inform data-driven decisions to improve environmental sustainability outcomes for DoorDash and our communities
Work both independently and collaboratively, including with cross-functional teams 

Were excited about you because...

You have 2-4 years of experience in operations, consulting, strategy, financial services, product operations, or related experience. High-growth or early-stage startup experience is a plus. 
You have at least intermediate analytics skills, including SQL, Excel, and data platforms like Sigma. (Beginner skill would be having a good understanding of concepts and syntax, while intermediate skill should enable you to easily tackle most new problems using your strong grasp of the field.) 
You are knowledgeable about the environmental sector. Direct experience is not required. 
You think about problems in very structured ways, and can analyze and synthesize data, make informed decisions, and balance this with empathy and intuition. 
You take action and try new things in order to accomplish a goal. 
You communicate complex topics in a clear, concise, and thorough way.

Title: Strategic Account Development Executive (Spanish Speaking)
Location: Houston, TX; Irvine, CA; Anaheim, CA
RoleDescription:
About the Team
On the Outside Account Development team, we expand on existing DoorDash partnerships, while identifying opportunities for further engagement, growth, and performance on our platform. We learn more about the merchant's business and growth goals, to build a path to success and increased ROI, while accommodating the variable needs of our partners.
About the Role
We're looking for outside sales executives to join us in a Strategic Account Development Executive role. The ideal candidate will be bilingual in Spanish AND English. You will connect existing merchant partners with new powerful tools on the DoorDash delivery platform. You will ensure the partnership terms make sense for both DoorDash and the merchant. You will ensure sustained success and increased sales. You will report to the Manager of Strategic Account Development in our Outside Sales organization. Once our offices reopen, we expect this role to be flexible with some time in-office (1-2 days/week), some time in the field (up to 40%), and some time working from home.
Historical performance including but not limited to attainment and optimization will be taken into consideration during the selection process. 
You're excited about this opportunity because you will...

Run your end-to-end sales process, with sales discovery and complex pipeline management skills
Excite our existing accounts on the potential to increase revenue share
Engage with strategic decision makers, including C-suite, VPs, and business owners, while using data to tell a compelling story
Close our partners on upgrades, upsells, and cross-sells of DoorDash platform products and marketing promotions
Use internal data and unit economics to explain forecasted revenue growth and how we offer customized sales packages to improve sales, growth, and brand perception

Title: Shift Lead
RoleDescription:
About the Team
DashMart is a local-fulfillment center owned and operated by DoorDash, offering customers fast, reliable, and high quality delivery. Customers order their convenience, grocery, retail, and prepared foods in the DoorDash app, and our team members fulfill orders in a real, brick-and-mortar store, for our Dashers to deliver. Were open early and close late - some sites even run 24/7!
About the Role
DashMart is looking for a motivated and experienced individual that excels in fast-paced, physical environments, and is excited to roll up their sleeves and actively engage in day-to-day operations.  In this role, you will work within a local-fulfillment center supporting Site Management running great shifts and delegating tasks. As a Shift Lead, you will have shift responsibility for fulfilling orders in a warehouse environment, maintaining inventory, and in some locations, this involves preparing food in a light-prep kitchen.
Youre excited about this opportunity because you will...

Be an Owner: Take ownership of your assigned shifts including warehouse and kitchen processes, safety/cleanliness, quality, and training. Maintain accountability for inventory, equipment, and other company assets to ensure they are properly handled, stored, and protected from loss or theft.
Delight Customers: Ensure customer orders are delivered with high quality by executing orders accurately, communicating with customers when issues arise, and making sure Dasher pickups go smoothly. 
Lead: Guide Operations Associates through their shift by ensuring the team works safely and productively, and serving as the point of escalation for daily operations.   
One Team One Fight: Support operations in both the warehouse and kitchen, assist with day-to-day tasks, and lead by example.You will be expected to engage in professional and respectful interactions with team members and customers, ensuring a positive and safe atmosphere in the warehouse while providing a high-quality experience for our customers.
Help improve Operations: Contribute ideas to improve our quality and customer experience. 

Were excited about you because...

Youre self-motivated, positive, and a team player. You work well with others, and you bring a great attitude to your work each and every day.  You have high integrity and are excited to delight customers.
You have a proven track record of success in food and beverage, warehouse, and/or retail environments.
Youre able to be on your feet, and move heavy products. You are excited and physically able (with or without accommodation) to lift up to 50 lbs depending on the needs of the specific site and can operate a pallet jack and hand truck.
You have the ability and desire to obtain and maintain a food handling certificate. (DoorDash will provide this training)
You have a high school diploma or GED equivalent. A college diploma is even better but not required. 
You are at least 18 years of age.
You're organized and proficient in Google Docs and Google Sheets.
You have flexibility in your schedule. Depending upon the scheduling needs of the hiring site, you can be available for a number of different shifts a week.

Benefits

Market Competitive pay 
Opportunity for pay increases twice a year based upon performance
Paid time off (PTO) and sick leave
Health benefits starting Day 1 (Medical, Dental, & Vision)
401k match
Gym membership reimbursement (up to $75/month)
Monthly DashPass subscription including access to HBO max and Lyft Discounts
Employee Assistance Program
Career advancement opportunities

Title: Manager, Dasher & Logistics - Dasher Financial Strategy & Operations
Location: New York, NY; Austin, TX; Washington, DC; San Francisco, CA; Sunnyvale, CA; Seattle, WA; Los Angeles, CA; Chicago, IL
RoleDescription:
About the Team
The Dasher & Logistics team supports the millions of Dashers who power DoorDashs marketplace. Were building the worlds leading last-mile logistics platform  and to succeed, well need to disrupt ourselves along the way. The Dasher Financial team is one such disruption: we are building fintech products that best serve the needs of Dashers and gig workers like them.
From instant access to earnings, to innovative bill pay and savings products, to credit-building tools, our goal is to create the financial system of record for Dashers. We are still early in this journey  launching and scaling zero-to-one products that redefine how Dashers interact with their money.
About the Role
We are looking for a Manager, Strategy & Operations to join our Dasher Financial team. This role is about building new fintech bets from the ground up  from testing early hypotheses to scaling into category-defining businesses.
As a Manager, you will operate like a GM-in-training: shaping strategy, owning execution, and ultimately building the P&L for a new fintech product line. Early projects may include leading our efforts in lending and credit, but the role will flex to whatever the highest-potential opportunities are for Dasher Financial.This is a rare opportunity to be at the forefront of fintech innovation inside a scaled platform. 
You will:

Identify new product opportunities, size the market, and build the business case.
Design and run experiments to validate user demand.
Own day-to-day execution and work cross-functionally to take ideas from concept to launch.
Define success metrics and be accountable for business outcomes.
Scale promising products into sustainable businesses that improve Dashers financial health.

Dasher Financial is an ambitious bet  building fintech products for the future of work. As a Manager, you will have end-to-end ownership of a new product line, from incubation to scale. Youll have the platform and data of DoorDash, but the freedom to build like a startup founder. For someone who aspires to be a GM or startup founder, this is a unique opportunity to learn by doing and build a business from zero to one.
Youre excited about this opportunity because you will...

Strategize: Develop the roadmap for new fintech bets and shape how DoorDash serves gig workers financially.
Own: Take full ownership of a product line, from metrics to operations to user adoption.
Influence: Work cross-functionally with Product, Engineering, Finance, Analytics, and Marketing to turn vision into execution.
Experiment & scale: Launch MVPs, measure user behavior, iterate quickly, and scale the ones that work.
Grow as a GM: Build the skills to run a full business line  strategy, P&L, operations, and product  within one of DoorDashs highest-potential growth areas.

Were excited about you because...

You have 5+ years of experience in high-growth environments (tech, fintech, strategy & ops, consulting, or banking).
You have a track record of taking ambiguous problems and turning them into scaled outcomes.
You are an exceptional problem solver who thrives on data-driven decision-making (comfortable with SQL/Excel).
You are curious, entrepreneurial, and thrive in zero-to-one environments.
You can flex between high-level strategy and ground-level execution, and you dont hesitate to get your hands dirty to deliver results.
